Question 1

In class, we focused on development of the field of probability by Gauss, Fermat, Pascal, and Fisher. However, there were several other contributors to the field of probability. One prominent contributor was Jakob Bernoulli, whose name may sound familiar if youâ€™ve heard of the Bernoulli probability distribution before in other contexts.

Read History of Probability (Part 3) - Jacob Bernoulli (1654-1705) â€“ Law of Large Numbers. Then, answer the following questions:

  • In your words, what is the law of large numbers?
  • How did we use the law of large numbers in DSC 10, and how did we use it in Lecture 5?
